page.title: 15A SATURDAY DIARY
page.content: A DAY IN THE LIFE OF KATHERINE KERR (AGE 12 YEARS). I got up at 7am and had cereal for breakfast. I put on grey trousers and pink and white blouse with my red jelly shoes. Then I went to the hairdresser's. Afterwards I changed into a white tennis skirt and T-shirt, with plimsoles ready for tennis. After playing I had a lunch of bread and steak. I went shopping in Woking by car with Jenny and her dad. We came back and I had tea which was a green salad. My family and I then went by car to a Swim, Disco, Bar-B-Q at Guildford Lido. I did a sponsored swim for money for secondary school P.T.A. I had a hot-dog. Later we came home and watched "Live Aid" on TV, a charity concert in aid of the famine in Ethiopia. I went to bed at 11pm but the concert lasted for 16 hours.
